home.title: open working hours
home.subtitle: An open-source initiative to track, validate, and aggregate real working hours in healthcare, with full anonymity and privacy protection for staff.

problem.title: The problem
problem.intro: Hospital staff work long and intense schedules. Planned shifts rarely match reality: emergencies extend hours, handovers take longer, and administrative tools often miss these deviations.

issues.fatigue: Staff experience unnoticed overtime and fatigue.
issues.compliance: Institutions struggle with compliance, reporting, and workforce planning.
issues.research: Research on workload and well-being lacks solid evidence.
issues.patients: Patients face a heightened risk of complications when overworked staff are fatigued or staffing levels are not accurately reflected.

problem.conclusion: There is currently no standardized, privacy-conscious system to verify real working hours in clinical environments.

solution.title: The solution
solution.intro: openworkinghours provides an open, verifiable way to record and review actual working time.

steps.shiftEntryDesc: Staff log their planned shifts via a mobile interface.
steps.trackingDesc: Optional, privacy-first location and activity data estimate real attendance.
steps.reviewDesc: Staff verify and correct tracked times before submission.

solution.result: The result: a trusted dataset that reflects real work patterns, owned and reviewed by the staff themselves.

features.architecture: Modular web architecture using open technologies (React, TUI Calendar, modern APIs).
features.mobile: Designed for mobile-first use in clinical contexts.
features.privacy: Privacy and anonymity by design: all tracking and review happen locally before any data is shared. Submissions can remain anonymous to protect staff from legal or contractual risk.
features.api: Open API for integration with existing HR, scheduling, or research systems.
features.contributions: Developers can contribute to independent modules: data collection, review interface, or institutional dashboard.

whyItMatters.title: Why it matters
whyItMatters.intro: Reliable working time data benefits everyone:

benefits.staff: Staff gain visibility into their workload and recognition for their effort, without compromising privacy or facing legal risk.
benefits.hospitals: Hospitals can optimize staffing, ensure compliance, and plan more effectively.
benefits.researchers: Researchers and policymakers gain evidence for improving work conditions and patient safety.
benefits.patients: Patients gain transparency on where staff are working within healthy limits, helping identify hospitals that maintain safer workloads and better care environments.

whyItMatters.conclusion: Transparency in working hours builds trust, supports fairness, and enhances the sustainability and safety of healthcare work.

status.title: Current status
status.intro: The MVP prototype is live with simulated data:

features.workflows: Core shift management and review workflows functional.

needs.developers: Developers to help refine modules and architecture.
needs.partners: Partner institutions to provide feedback and letters of intent for pilot testing.
